p: Whole hemp seeds contain approximately 25–35% (by weight) of lipids and 20–25% crude proteins [ 1, 17]. The results of the current study are consistent with the previously established ranges since seeds from Fedora cv. exhibited an average content of 27.2 g 100 g −1 of lipids and 24.8 g 100 g −1 of crude proteins ( Table 1).
